result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clint Bruce Roberts

records.addlTxt:
9:20 AM Defendant Clint Bruce Roberts in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Clint Bruce Roberts.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman notes that there have been discussions. Asks for another status to determine if the case will settle or be set for trial.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:41 AM Defendant Clint Bruce Roberts in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Clint Bruce Roberts.  Attorney Chad La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman notes that offer has been made, asks for another status to make counteroffer. State is in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:32 AM Defendant Clint Bruce Roberts in court.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Clint Bruce Roberts. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status. Court accepts pleas. State has no objection to status.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
9:27 AM Defendant Clint Bruce Roberts in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Clint Bruce Roberts. Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clint Bruce Roberts appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Clint Bruce Roberts. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $1500 cash. No contact with Palace Bar. Reviews defendant's prior criminal conviction, notes active warrant in MN. Attorney Hoffman indicates defendant has lived in the area for 13 years and has employment. Defendant does not have any money to post. Court orders $1500 cash bail. No contact with Palace Bar.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
